FacilityName: Air Products and Chemicals Decatur Terminal

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Air Products and Chemicals, Inc.

Decatur, Alabama Liquid Hydrogen Terminal



At this facility, we store and transport liquid hydrogen. The hydrogen product stored in the amounts handled by our facility, are considered hazardous by the EPA. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal and state rules and regulations. Air Products manages the safety of the regulated processes by means of operating procedures, equipment testing and inspections, safety devices (e.g. instrumentation, relief devices) inherent in the design of this facility and other controls and systems designed to prevent accidental release of hazardous chemicals.

Safe work practices and training of our personnel supplement the inherent safe design of the plant.



Our emergency response program is based upon OSHA's HAZWOPER regulation. The emergency response plan includes procedures for the notification of the local fire authority.



This document has been prepared in accordance with the EPA's Risk Management Plan regulation (40 CFR, Part 68). The substances and processes considered during the preparation of this RMP and the scenarios described were selected based on criteria established in the regulation.



One of the principal purposes of this facility is to transport liquid hydrogen. This facility ships and temporarily stores liquid hydrogen. Hydrogen is used by our customers in their manufacturing processes. Delivery to our customers is via tank truck.



The facility complies with the Federal EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Plan, and OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation. The design and construction of the facility complies with applicable state and industry codes.



The facility's emergency response program is based upon OSHA's HAZWOPER standard. At this site, employees are trained to recognize emergencies and initiate emergency response from the LEPC and outside agencies.  The employees receive annual refresher training in their role in the emergency plan. Emergency

response activities have also been coordinated with the Decatur Fire Department and other appropriate local responders so that appropriate measures can be taken to control accidental releases. Periodic drills are conducted to review the effectiveness of our emergency procedures.
